|rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The test report states the hardware as '''4900D00B''' which would strongly indicate that the device was manufactured by '''SerComm'''.
Aditional information:
- MX29LV320MBTC-90G can operate in 8 and 16 bit mode and support CFI protocol. On this board it is atached over 8bit bus. In this canse, for example for jtag, it should be specially configured. In openocd use x16_as_x8 option:
flash bank someflash cfi 0xbe000000 0x00400000 1 1 ar231x.cpu x16_as_x8
- Processord ID: 0x0001800a ([[MIPS 4Kc]])
- All firmware versions are based on VxWorks 5.4.2 ==Links of Interest== [http://www.0xf8.org/2009/07/hacking-the-netgear-wg102-access-point/ Hacking the Netgear WG102 Access Point]
